title: Distance Learning Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Riverside City College in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: committee interview consisting of about 5-6 staff/faculty. No one was interested or engaging with me through the interview it was more of a ask the questions and let’s get it over with to check the boxes. The questions were based on the skills of the position which I normally don’t mind but I study the job description and it was something completely different than advertised. One example is the software used for the position. I was also thrown into an assessment with the expectation of knowing the software when my resume clearly describes my certifications.
Interview Questions: What are the accessible issues that faculty encounter.

title: Admin Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Riverside City College (Riverside, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: During COVID, so a pane of 5 interviewed me on Zoom.  Felt very impersonal.  When the candidates were told they didn’t make the cut to the 2nd interview, it was sent out as a group message.  Couldn’t believe the lack of confidentiality on HR’s part.  Everyone candidate’s email address showed up on my own message.  Including the “reply-to-all” responses!  Yikes!
Interview Questions: What is your definition of diversity and how has it effected you in the workplace?

title: Disability Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Riverside City College (Riverside, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process can sometimes be very competitive depending on the salary grade your going for. Some times the  panel can be biased and already have a person in mind.
Interview Questions: Please describe what makes you qualified for this position?

title: Instructional Department Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Riverside City College in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through HR site, two months later received an email invitation to interview, selected date and time. The interview was conducted via zoom with six members on the interview committee; three assistant professors, one instructional department specialist, one employment placement coordinator, and one human resource generalist.
Interview Questions:
Q: Have you worked with a diverse population of students and faculty/staff? 
Q: Situation student comes in your office, the phone is ringing, and you have a request from a department chair for a report. In order what do you take care of first. 
Q: Explain your process for a large data entry project? 
Q: Do you have any experience sending large communication out to students? 
Q: What do you know about our department? 
Q: What programs are you familiar with? 
Q: Why should we hire you?

title: Student Financial Services Outreach Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Riverside City College
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email that included my interview date, time and location. I came in and the HR rep gave me a packet containing the panelists, job description and interview. Gave me some time to prepare answers

title: SGL Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Riverside City College (Riverside, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour interview with one of the bosses where they just ask you about leadership, and your academic traits and success. They also asked if you had any experience tutoring or anything related.
Interview Questions: Do you think anyone can be good at math?

title: Cafeteria Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Riverside City College (Riverside, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and was called to confirm when my interview would be. I got an interview within a couple weeks and it was held in the cafeteria at the boss's room. It was during the summer, before fall semester began. Very friendly and easy interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Do you have any experience working with food?
Do you have a food handler's card already?

title: Supplemental Instructional Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Riverside City College (Riverside, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to give a brief demo of how to conduct a study session. The group of interviewers pretended to be my students. I prepared a presentation on teaching some rules of Linear Algebra.
Interview Questions: Describe a method that can help students to memorize the rules of math.

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Riverside City College (Riverside, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process...from the initial application in September to the offer in December. The online application was quite involved, requiring letters of reference and transcripts. There were 3 total in-person interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with students and diverse populations?

title: Adjuct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Riverside City College (Riverside, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: very intense. nerve wracking; it was a panel interview and everyone gets a chance to ask uyou questions and it is situational and very hard at time that you have to constantly answer to the  questions that they ask.
Interview Questions: what is your perception of the school
